title: Austrian School: Mises, Rothbard & Hayek
description: The Austrian school's systematic exposition of free market economics from praxeological foundations. Mises's human action, Rothbard's reconstruction from axioms, and Hayek's warnings against central planning and defense of spontaneous order.
keyContributions: Mises: Praxeology - logic of human action, critique of socialism
Rothbard: Systematic reconstruction from Austrian axioms, anarcho-capitalism
Hayek: Spontaneous order, knowledge problem, rule of law
researchValue: Most comprehensive statement of free market economics from methodological individualist foundations. Essential for understanding modern libertarian economics and critiques of central planning.
